text: Hi, my name is Narita, Amazon DynamoDB Specialist SA.
I am a member of the team that provides technical support for using Amazon DynamoDB.
Until now, AWS has introduced various features and tips of DynamoDB on youtube under the name of Amazon DynamoDB Nuggets.
Some of you may have missed it because it was only in English. Therefore, we would like to introduce a digest of what features we have explained in Japanese.
Amazon DynamoDB has various features, which are introduced in various places such as development documents, AWS Blog, Japanese translated blogs, various session videos, and live shows on Twitch.
If you want to know more about a specific feature, this is the place to go! Amazon DynamoDB Nuggets will be very useful if you want to know about a specific feature right away.
Here are some videos that have already been posted."Understanding and Avoiding DynamoDB Throttling".
This video explains the mechanism by which throttling errors, which are very important when using DynamoDB, are determined. This video explains how to avoid them based on the mechanism of
This video explains how to avoid these errors. First, it explains how throttling is determined in Provisioned mode, and how to avoid it when using On demand mode and when using On demand mode.
The following video explains how to avoid Hot Keys caused by low cardinality keys.
The following video shows the difference between using Kiensis Data Streams and DDB Streams"KDS vs DDB Streams".
DynamoDB has the ability to retrieve modified data via the stream API. And you can choose which stream you want to use.
This video introduces DynamoDB Streams and Kinesis Data Streams, and the patterns of event-driven architecture based on the features of each.
The next video is"DynamoDB Backup-Restore."
DynamoDB offers several backup options: on-demand backup, integration with AWS Backup, PITR, and S3 export/import,

This section introduces the features of these options and what kind of requirements you need to choose from. By choosing the backup option that matches your various requirements, you will be able to achieve a more cost-optimized backup/restore.
"GSI vs LSI".This video explains the criteria for choosing between GSI and LSI.
Why does DynamoDB have two types of secondary indexes?

This is a history of improvements in DynamoDB.DynamoDB has gone through a series of improvements regarding search, and has been released in the order of LSI and GSI. Thus, GSI is a more improved version of the limitations of LSI.
Rather than distinguishing between GSI and LSI depending on use cases, it is easier to think of GSI as an improvement of LSI.
Since LSIs have various limitations today, we hope you will consider whether you should choose LSIs based on the explanations in the video.
The next video is"GSI vs Scan."
GSI is a very attractive feature, but sometimes it can be difficult to decide whether to use GSI or not.
This video explains how SCAN can be more cost effective than always having GSI ready for infrequently accessed workloads.If you are running similar workloads, you may want to take a look at this.
The last video is."Pre-Warming a DynamoDB Table."
This video explains how to use On-demand mode, for example, if you have a specific use for an event andThis video introduces the procedure of pre-warming when using On-demand mode,
for example, when the default throughput of On-demand mode is not enough for an event.
It also introduces some points to keep in mind when pre-warming. Please take a look at this page, especially if you are planning to use the system on a large scale.
Amazon DynamoDB Nuggets will continue to post new videos as they become available. If you have a video you would like to see translated into Japanese, please let us know.

If you would like to know about other features or best practices, please let us know in the comments of this video.You can also check out our Youtube channel for more videos on DynamoDB and other topics.
Finally, you can also follow us on Twitter to stay up-to-date on new DynamoDB-specific updates for developers, as well as to stay informed about new videos posted on DynamoDB Nuggets.
https://twitter.com/dynamodb   That's all for now, thank you very much.
